DataElement.preferredDefinition: the assignment of TNM categories into groups used to select and evaluate therapy, estimate prognosis, and calculate end results for a malignant anal neoplasm.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the grouping of a malignant anal neoplasm (cancer), carcinomas that arise from the anus and include anal canal and anal margin (perianal skin) carcinomas.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer relating to the anus.  Tumors of the anal margin (below the anal verge and involving the perianal hair-bearing skin) are classified with skin tumors.

Concepts.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the anal canal or perianal skin.  Representative examples include carcinomas, lymphomas, and melanomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Grouping; a system for classifying things into groups; the activity of putting things together in groups.

Concepts.definition: A system for classifying things into groups or the activity of putting things together in groups.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the stage grouping for a malignant anal neoplasm (cancer), carcinomas that arise from the anus and include anal canal and anal margin (perianal skin) carcinomas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0 anal cancer corresponds to the following TNM grouping: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Carcinoma in situ.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th Ed.) - 2003

Concepts.longName: Stage 0 Anal Canal Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0.  Tis: Carcinoma in situ.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I anal cancer corresponds to the following TNM grouping: (T1, N0, M0).  T1: Tumor is 2 cm or less in greatest dimension.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th Ed.) - 2003

Concepts.longName: Stage I Anal Canal Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: T1, N0, M0.  T1: Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II anal cancer corresponds to the following TNM groupings: (T2, N0, M0), (T3,N0,M0).  T2: Tumor is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  T3: Tumor is more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th Ed.)- 2003

Concepts.longName: Stage II Anal Canal Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: (T2, N0, M0); (T3,N0, M0).  T2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  T3: Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer has spread to the lymph nodes around the rectum or to nearby organs such as the vagina or bladder.

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIA Anal Canal Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: (T1, N1, M0); (T2, N1, M0); (T3, N1, M0); (T4, N0, M0). T1: Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension.  T2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  T3: Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  T4: Tumor of any size that invades adjacent organ(s).  N1: Metastasis in perirectal lymph node(s).  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer has spread to the lymph nodes in the middle of the abdomen or in the groin, or the cancer has spread to both nearby organs and the lymph nodes around the rectum.

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIB Anal Canal Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: (T4, N1, M0); (Any T, N2, M0); (Any T, N3, M0). T4: Tumor of any size that invades adjacent organ(s).  N1: Metastasis in perirectal lymph node(s).  N2: Metastasis in unilateral internal iliac and/or inguinal lymph node(s).  N3: Metastasis in perirectal and inguinal lymph nodes and/or bilateral internal iliac and/or inguinal lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV anal cancer corresponds to the following TNM groupings: (Any T, Any N, M1). M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th Ed.) - 2003

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Anal Canal Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: (Any T, Any N, M1).  M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

DataElement.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form
